section: Accuray may introduce changes and upgrades to the Products. Accuray will use commercially reasonable efforts to give Distributor as much advance notice of upgrades as is feasible.
explanation: The term "commercially reasonable efforts" is ambiguous without a specific definition or set of criteria to determine what constitutes such efforts in the context of providing advance notice. The lack of clarity could lead to disputes over whether Accuray adequately fulfilled this obligation.

section: Distributor shall report promptly and in writing to Accuray any complaints or expressions of dissatisfaction by the Customers to Distributor relating to the Products or Services. Any such reports shall be provided to Accuray via electronic mail to the following address: complaints@accuray.com.
explanation: The term "promptly" is ambiguous and does not define a specific timeframe within which the Distributor must report customer complaints. This lack of clarity could lead to disputes over whether the Distributor has met its obligation to report complaints in a timely manner.

section: Distributor shall transfer to Accuray upon Accuray's request: any regulatory clearances, licenses or permits obtained for conduct of the business pursuant to this Agreement; any Confidential Information; and other items as negotiated in good faith between the parties.
explanation: The phrase "other items as negotiated in good faith between the parties" is vague and indefinite. It does not provide any objective criteria or guidelines for determining what "other items" should be transferred, and it relies on the subjective standard of "good faith" negotiation, which can be difficult to prove or enforce. This ambiguity could lead to disputes over whether the parties have fulfilled their obligations under this clause.
